required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A PK Study Comparing VeraCept vs. ParaGard Intrauterine Devices (IUDs)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Single-Blind, Comparative Bioavailability Study to Assess the Pharmacokinetic Properties of VeraCept™ Intrauterine Contraceptive vs ParaGard® in Healthy, Post-Menarcheal Women

brief_summary.textblock: to Assess the Pharmacokinetic Properties of VeraCept™ Intrauterine Contraceptive vs ParaGard® in Healthy, Post- Menarcheal Women

study_design_info.masking_description: Subjects are blinded until the Day 57 Visit

primary_outcome.measure: Observed systemic copper bioavailability of VeraCept vs. ParaGard
primary_outcome.description: Assess the relative bioavailability of observed systemic copper from VeraCept versus ParaGard based on Cmax

primary_outcome.measure: Observed systemic copper bioavailability of VeraCept vs. ParaGard
primary_outcome.description: Assess the relative bioavailability of observed systemic copper from VeraCept versus ParaGard based on Cmean

primary_outcome.measure: Observed systemic copper bioavailability of VeraCept vs. ParaGard
primary_outcome.description: Assess the relative bioavailability of observed systemic copper from VeraCept versus ParaGard based on Area Under the Curve (AUC)0-56 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline-corrected total serum copper of VeraCept vs. ParaGard
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the relative bioavailability of baseline-corrected total serum copper from the VeraCept IUD versus ParaGard based on Cmax

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline-corrected total serum copper of VeraCept vs. ParaGard
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the relative bioavailability of baseline-corrected total serum copper from the VeraCept IUD versus ParaGard based on Cmean

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline-corrected total serum copper of VeraCept vs. ParaGard
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the relative bioavailability of baseline-corrected total serum copper from the VeraCept IUD versus ParaGard based on AUC0-56 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare total serum copper levels of VeraCept vs. ParaGard compared to normal copper levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through Day 56 for ParaGard and through Year-5 for VeraCept
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the total serum copper levels within each treatment relative to the normal range (49 to 184 µg/dL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term stability of copper levels as determined by Cmax - VeraCept only
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Year 3 and Year 5 as determined by PK samples drawn at each visit
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the long-term stability of copper levels following insertion of the VeraCept IUD

arm_group.description: VeraCept subjects will be inserted with VeraCept on Day 1. At Day 57 subjects will be informed that they received VeraCept and may continue in the study for up to 5 years

ParaGard subjects will be inserted with ParaGard on Day 1. At Day 57 subjects will be informed that they received ParaGard and may choose to have the ParaGard removed or continue use per standard of clinical care.
